programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: New information is revealed, and questions are answered about the mystery of the RMS Republic, her gold cargo, and Martin Bayerle's obsessive quest to recover the bounty.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy lays down a bet against Chase and Holden, Daniel's bragging wears Dwaine down, and Gunner causes trouble for Bruce.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The boat captains grow desperate for bluefin tuna, and some launch clever espionage operations in an attempt to spy on the fish, as well as their opponents.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The contest enters week five - and with the bluefin tuna as scarce as ever, the captains try new ways to outsmart their opponents.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimi Hendrix's former photographer visits the shop with a selection of unpublished pictures, and the team values two dune buggies and a 1930s denim jacket.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick values a device for predicting the outcome of horse races, and is shocked when a customer brings in a secret service ID and some counterfeit money.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Jo Caulfield joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: A look at the obsession with customer feedback, asking just how reliable this data is, as Dave tries to find out with the help of people who like a very specific type of soup.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Davina McCall, Jimmy Carr, Alice Levine and Reginald D Hunter.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer, Gemma Whelan, Tom Rosenthal and Lizzie Roper join Alan for amusingly aimless banter, which veers from Game of Thrones to shoplifting and mistaken identity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: Divers search a newly discovered wreck as they investigate the story of the SS Justicia, sunk in the First World War by U-Boats off the coast of Ireland.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The stories of famous hoaxes, featuring personal accounts of those who perpetrated and exposed them, beginning with the infamous alien autopsy footage.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: Revealing how a famous photo of the Loch Ness Monster taken in 1934 took the world by storm, and examining the truth behind the image.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: A look at the making of the prison sitcom, originally shown to coincide with its 40th anniversary. Writers Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais guide cameras around the pivotal places they visited during the creation and development of the series, including the pub where they first met, the prisons they researched, and the filming locations they used. Plus, contributions by the show's admirers, surviving members of the cast and members of the production crew.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick is informed that the Communists have kidnapped his sausage and are demanding a ransom, and a plan is devised for Ren√© to pay it.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick interrogates Gruber about The Fallen Madonna with the Big Boobies and Rene repays Monsieur Alphonse using forged notes. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Guy Siner and Richard Gibson.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Three brave rescue attempts are launched when the dastardly Von Klinkerhoffen catches Maria and the Fallen Madonna, and the General discovers the sausage and hangs it in his closet.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Mars is one of the best-explored places in the solar system and yet we still don't know the answer to the big question - is there or was there life on Mars?.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

credits.director: Don Maddox features in the footage
he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Robert tries to arrange a love-match between Eleanor and one of his old comrades-in-arms, but meets with a conspicuous lack of success. Then a belligerent boxer with head injuries gives him an unexpected helping hand, and medicine starts taking a back seat to romance at the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Regina and George return to Ash Park from their wedding, and are warned about their marriage of convenience by Elizabeth and Carolyn. Meanwhile, Sarah attempts to arrange Rene's funeral and is offered emotional and practical support by Roy and Doris Collins. Elsewhere, Gino accidentally finds and reads Ann's novel, and Elizabeth is invited to a function in Sydney by Douglas Goddard.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George consummates his marriage to Regina after she spikes his drink with morphine, and warns her it will never happen again. Sarah returns to work at the hospital, although Jack worries it is too soon after Rene's death, and Douglas invites Elizabeth to accompany him on holiday.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Relishing the social prestige it confers, Hyacinth decides that she and husband Richard should have a weekend at a golfing hotel so that she can keep up with the Major and his wife. Roy Clarke's suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is thrown into dismay when her beloved father goes to the register office to be married, and things go from bad to worse when her neighbour Emmett comes face to face with her uncouth relatives, Daisy, Onslow and Rose.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth dreads the idea of attending Onslow's birthday celebrations. However, she changes her mind when she learns a limousine will be arriving to take her to the party. Starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Fairley and Harrow are sent to the Outback to investigate a multiple-death car collision in Fairley's home town of Eurella Creek. When Fairley finds out that Harrow slept with Grace, he bluntly tells him he has a tendency to ruin people's lives. Harrow also learns that Fairley is a local hero for rescuing three children from a house fire in 1991, but still feels guilty about failing to rescue the fourth one. Maxine confronts Grace about not facing the demons of her past. Australian drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The team is drawn into the world of a strict religious sect when a father and son are murdered with copies of the Bible at their sides. Burke grows increasingly irate as the secretive community closes ranks, refusing to speak to non-members, and he suspects the leader James Hardie knows more about the killings than he is letting on. Meanwhile, Reid investigates the disappearance of an old friend's daughter and uncovers a link to Burke's case. Detective drama, guest starring Sandy Morton, with Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Pathologist Duncan Clark (Davood Ghadami) begins work with Burke and Reid on the case of a tortured and mutilated body found in a vacant warehouse. After identifying the victim as newly qualified doctor Scott Clarkson, they discover he may been involved in a drugs scam, but the investigation is complicated by the unexpected arrival of London cops DI Casey and DS Moretti. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Reece Dinsdale (Coronation Street) and Steve John Shepherd (Plus One), with Blythe Duff, John Michie and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Dalziel witnesses a shooting through a neighbour's window and rushes to the scene to find a dead woman, whose husband is suspected of being responsible for the incident. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Michael Kitchen and Josette Simon.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to ¬£10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's helping out at an understaffed veterinary clinic. In fact, he's at the supermarket, where Fizz is trying to sell his cleaning products..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: An unusual stray dog arrives at the Mikkelsens and is welcomed in with open arms. Mike, however, has suspicions. Who is this new pup.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Tom walks in and catches Mercury trying to break into in the garage. He thinks Mercury would make the cool, exciting pet he's always wanted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An endless cacophony of loud noises from next door drives Mr Bean to distraction, filling his mind with thoughts of revenge.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean pretends he's been the victim of an accident in the hope of gaining attention, but ends up in hospital.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A small village's goats are being terrorized.

programme.title: LEGO DC Comics: Batman Be-Leaguered (2014)
programme.desc: All your Lego favourites as Batman refuses to join the Justice League. But when Superman, the Flash, Aquaman and Wonder Woman disappear it's up to Batman to save the day.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Nick Nairn for a trip aboard luxury train the Royal Scotsman. During the journey, James visits the train's kitchens to prepare a traditional duck a l'orange. Along the way they stop off at a bakery in a former prisoner of war camp and historic Scone Palace, where they prepare ham and cheese toastie in the grounds.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan shows how to grow a summer feast of strawberries, even if the only space available is a doorstep, and family-friendly ways to grow delicious vegetables. His Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney join in from their homes with clever hacks and tips to get viewers making the most out of their gardens, window boxes or windowsills.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at competitive sheep shearing in north Wales and Liz Bonnin is on the Isle of Mull, spotting pods of migrating dolphins who are returning to the shores. Plus, a visit to the Sussex home of Zoe Ball, who gives a tour of her own back garden before heading off to the National Trust's Standen House for some tips on how to make her garden grow.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: John Barnes and Matt Le Tissier were both flying the flag for England in the recent ITV show Harry's Heroes - but now they're on different sides as they take part in the knockout quiz, captaining teams comprising members of their own families in a bid to make it through to the next round. At stake for the eventual winners is ¬£25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The Chase star Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty is the one asking the questions for once.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Swindon in Wiltshire plays host to David Dickinson and his dealers. Tim Hogarth and Tracy Thackray-Howitt meet a host of creature collectibles, while Stewart Hofgartner looks to lock down a deal on a decorative safe.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees a family from Leeds competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Jurassic Park III (2001)
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Dr Alan Grant is lured to a dinosaur-infested island by a divorced couple who offer to fund his research, unaware their real motive is to find their missing son - and that the creatures on the island are far more intelligent than anyone suspected. Action adventure sequel, starring Sam Neill, William H Macy, Tea Leoni and Alessandro Nivola.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
programme.desc: Three years after the destruction of Jurassic World, Owen Grady and Claire Dearing are asked to return to the theme park to save its resident dinosaurs from the island's active volcano. During their mission, they uncover a conspiracy that may affect the entire planet. Action sequel, starring Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Rafe Spall and Toby Jones.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. As well as forgotten gems from the telly archives, his 1980s fashion choices and hairstyles, viewers will also get to relive those moments of TV gold that have turned him into one of the country's most adored stars. Presented by Jason Manford.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover
programme.desc: Kisstory is taking over with non-stop old skool and anthems.

programme.title: Return Of The 90s Anthems
programme.desc: We're taking you back to the 90s with some of the ultimate anthems we still can't get enough of.

programme.title: The Kisstory Takeover

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: Having been kicked off their gold mine, Scott and George need to buy a new claim to keep their dreams alive. However, raising the necessary cash involves a dangerous deal.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates a cluster of ancient ruins in New England that suggest Europeans arrived in the Americas almost 1,000 years before Columbus.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The staff of Orange County Choppers build a specialised trike for the last winning fan, Bryan King, who was left paralysed after a car accident.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The use of transport planes in Russian air assault operations, and an examination of recent designs such as jet seaplanes.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Queen Creek, Arizona, to press olives into oil, before cleaning dirty diapers in Sacramento.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in manufacturing rope, billiard tables and sailboards, and how advances in technology have led to improved production methods.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes involved in creating seatbelts, hot-air balloons, windows and wax figurines, and how these methods have adapted to modern technology.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Heli-duster Brett takes protecting crops to a new level, while using every trick in the trade, Scott veers between Outback crises. Trevor and Josh dance with danger in strong winds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne travels to Georgia, where he uncovers an ultra-rare, completely original 1921 Stutz Bearcat that has sat garaged for a staggering 85 years.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds one of only 1,000 Mini Cooper S MC40s ever made, the 40th anniversary homage to the Monte Carlo rally-winning British icon.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien assess sewing machines in Kent as they continue their journey across the UK to find unique and valuable items 'lost' in people's homes.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on the restoration of a music box damaged during the Blitz, a threadbare toy lamb and a pair of fire tongs built by the owner's own great-grandfather.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Gramophone guru Tim Weeks takes on the restoration of a huge early 20th-century record player and radio. Jay Blades and the team also repair a broken pipe and a huge blue ceramic pitcher that is missing several pieces.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UK's last leather factories.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the island's biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne travels to Georgia, where he uncovers an ultra-rare, completely original 1921 Stutz Bearcat that has sat garaged for a staggering 85 years.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The arrival of a 747 Jumbo Jet has the team members itching to dismantle this giant of the sky. However, they immediately struggle fitting it into the parking bay.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits the medieval Ely Cathedral in Cambridgeshire and finds pew connected a great Victorian architect. Later, he finds a Second World War bomber crew seat at an aviation museum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 19th-century Bradford weaving mill, where he discovers industrial trolleys and containers. In Cheshire, he visits a manor house mentioned in the Domesday book.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle an antique child's rocking chair, a vintage cash register, and a miniature Peter Pan gramophone that is no longer able to play records.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: When astronomers discover a rogue black hole speeding through the Milky Way, they investigate how much danger it poses to Earth.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Expert miners come to the aid of south-east Asian islanders hoping to extract gold from vast reserves found deep in the heart of crocodile territory.

programme.title: Who Killed Jeffrey Epstein: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Exclusive interviews and an in-depth investigation reveal new clues about Jeffrey Epstein's seedy underworld, privileged life and controversial death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 14-year-old April Millsap, whose body was recovered from a bike trail near the village of Armada, Michigan in July 2014. Millsap's dog, Penny, alerted a pair of joggers to the girl's remains. James VanCallis was later convicted of attempted sexually assault and murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How convicts escaped jail in 1996 to add yet another bank robbery to their tally of heists before they were apprehended by the FBI.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When a cat is brought to the Houston SPCA suffering from severe burns, the case leads to the animal's 14-year-old owner and a bottle of lighter fuel.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A three-day-old kitten with a badly twisted leg needs a series of splints to save her, and female loggerhead turtles are in the midst of laying eggs, and some have begun to hatch.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori does not normally allow men in her salon, but when a group of brides ignore her and the lads start to cause chaos, her team must take control.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Mamas and Dramas and Tears, Oh My!
programme.desc: Lori and her team encounter some of their biggest conflicts yet, including a Nascar bride in distress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The team helps a bride who has tried on 150 dresses, another who already owns two wedding gowns, and one who sets the record for the longest appointment yet.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: A cat is brought into the clinic soon after giving birth, could there be another kitten on the way? Plus, Alison and Audrey check out some lumps on a golden retriever.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr. Peter performs risky surgery on a guinea pig. Plus, a German Shepherd is rushed into the clinic with suspected paralysis from a tick and a snake needs specialist help. S1/5/10

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 600lbs each, Vianey and Allen are in a co-dependent relationship based on a shared love of food. However, they are both determined to conquer their food addiction together.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Self-described 'secret eater' Doug is managing to hide his snacking. However, his obesity is stopping him from living a full life with his wife, who is now demanding a change.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the 'bad guys' were after him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride chooses between two different styles of dress, while a customer wants a beaded gown with a lot of flashy decoration thrown in.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer brings her mother and sister with her to help choose a dress, and another bride does not know what she wants - but is very clear about what she does not like.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Franc and the consultants have their hands full trying to keep the brides and their mothers happy, while for one customer it is all about what her dad thinks.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Ciara Martin returns to Vows for the final fitting of her much-altered wedding dress, while Anne Marie Doyle's eight-year-old daughter is not keen on her mother's first choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: New mum Deirdre McCarthy needs to find a dress quickly as her wedding is fast approaching, while Jayme Dobson has flown from Australia ahead of her June 2019 wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Elizabeth Jones wants to look like a princess on her wedding day, while Sharon Dineen's entourage includes her eldest daughter on Skype from Canada.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Bride Eimear wants a boho-style dress, whilst Mairead seeks a gown to flaunt her weight loss, while Cora Anne is remembering her dad in her search for a bridal frock.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Ireland
programme.desc: Wedding planner Peter 'Franc' Kelly meets an Italian bride-to-be, another hoping to find a dress fit for a princess and a woman buying a dress for her mother.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo throws her hand in the mix when Larry Jr hosts a poker game, while a girl hopes to hear from her late brother in a group reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo contemplates why she was chosen to have her psychic gift, while a woman hears an unexpected message from her deceased mother.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa tries to carry on with her daily duties after the Caputo family's dog goes missing.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo swaps mediumship for match-making when she sets her cousin up with a new man.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: How Do I Get Out of This?
programme.desc: Featuring a woman whose mountain of possessions makes her daily life a challenge, and a man who overcame drink and drug addictions, but cannot stop collecting items.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: A study of Albert DeSalvo, dubbed the 'Boston Strangler'. He admitted to 13 murders, but some people believe his confession was false.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: Casey is angered when his parent's blame his obesity on video games, and Amanda suffers from post-surgery pains so bad that she has to go into hospital.

programme.title: Obese and Expecting
programme.desc: Documentary following four morbidly obese pregnant women as they suffer health crises and relationship breakdowns, all while striving to deliver healthy babies.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a drug-dependent landlady killed and buried seven victims for their social security cheques. Plus, a serial murderer is convicted on the basis of DNA evidence, 12 years after committing the crime.
